results.title: Auto suggestion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “This Is Britain”.
Illustrates technical advances in the British motor-car industry showing the fine quality and workmanship of products manufactured. Cars shown include the following: Daimler Straight Eight, Rolls-Royce Silver Wraith, Morris Minor, Vauxhall Wyvern, Austin A40, Hillman Minx, Ford Prefect, Triumph Mayflower, Jaguar XK120 amd Mark VII Saloon, Ford Consul, Triumph Roadster, production version of the 2.1/2 litre Aston Marton, Bristol 401, and the experimental Rover Gas Turbine prototype.

results.title: Auto stories
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, December Films, Tony Wright and Stuart Menzies
results.brief_description: Automobiles play a dominant role in 20th century society, making a personal statement about the owner and providing them with a functional vehicle, and for some - an obsession. These 4 half hour segments are united by the fascination between people and their cars. “Affairs of the heart” (Dir: Steve Westh): Dennis, proud owner of Marilyn Monaro - a 1975 Holden Monaro GTS coupe reminisces about past journeys in the vehicle as he prepares to put it on the market. His wife, Rhonda, describes how she copes with her husband’s obsession, meanwhile, we get to spend a day with employees and potential car owners at Melbourne’s Cheapest Car Supermarket. “Wrong way: go back” (Dir: Catherine Marciniak): Follow Vic Roads traffic clearer Neil Dwight as he makes sure the arterials of Melbourne are free from obstruction. The program also follows the decision making process of the Knox City Council as they grapple with the proposed Scoresby Freeway. “Til death do us part” (Dir: Fiona Hergstrom): Speed, alcohol and young males, what is the correlation? A young male involved in a car accident involving alcohol describes how it has affected his life since then. We also witness young drivers at a driver education centre as they go through the ropes of safe driving. “A Little inconvenience” (Dir: Helen Gaynor): Louise scours for someone to insure he Renault after it is involved in a minor accident. The process proves to be a lot lengthier than anticipated.

results.title: Autistic Syndrome 1
results.creator_credit: Stichting Film and Wetenschap Universitaire Film
results.brief_description: Presents some aspects of psychotherapy in a three year old autistic girl during her first year of residential treatment. We see her with her twin sister and with her therapist. A year later the twin sisters are observed with interest focused on changes in behaviour. No other credits available.

results.title: Autistic child: a behavioural approach
results.creator_credit: CRM Educational Films and William Rose
results.brief_description: Describes some of the characteristic behaviours exhibited by autistic children and illustrates the use of detailed behavioural techniques to teach language and apropriate behaviour. Shows how training in language and social skills can make a dramatic difference in outcome for autistic children.

results.title: Autism: who cares (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Horizontal Films, Victorian Autistic Children's Association and Ivan Gaal
results.brief_description: Four centres for autistic children in Victoria show how they deal with this problem. Details how they are able to teach the children to eventually integrate into the community. Photographer: Leigh Tilson

results.title: Autism without tears
results.creator_credit: Mansfield Playschool and Joan M. Curtis
results.brief_description: Produced to help people understand the autistic child. The Mansfield Playschool is conducted during the Christmas period as a holiday and instructional camp for autistic children and their families. Simple demonstrations of work being done and the reason for the use of special techniques are included. Narrated by Dr Joan M. Curtis.

results.title: Autism : The Early Signs
results.brief_description: This video comes with an education kit produced by the Autistic Family Support Association. Together they promote the early detection and diagnosis of autism in young children. The video is a visual representation of the behavioural characteristics of autism, and, through three case studies, shows the difficulties arising from living with a child who appears normal but whose behaviour is disturbing. Most importantly, it stresses the role of parents, people working with young children and health professionals in picking up the first clues that a child may be autistic.

group_works.title: Margaret Atwood
group_works.creator_credit: TV Ontario, Tier One Communications and Tracey Fisher

results.title: Authority and rebellion
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great Themes of Literature”.
This specially edited version of the film adapted from Herman Wouk’s The Caine Mutiny explores the first half of the novel - the events leading up to the mutiny. As in the novel, the film focuses on a young naval officer who has been taught to revere authority, but faced with an authority that has abnegated its responsibilities, goes along with the rebellion.

results.title: Autarky
results.brief_description: Explores digital technology integrated harmoniously with nature. Females are biologically linked to the natural environment and the film explores the patriarchal social system using visual symbolic reference to goddess themes.
